data.persona: I am a King who rules a large country. I make rules and laws my citizens must obey. I am a very fair king and I like to see my people prosper
data.description:
You are in the Confessions room.
This is a small, dark, confined wooden space with a divider that separates the priest taking the confession and the church goer.  There is a small seat on each side so that they can take their time discussing their sins.
The priest is here.

You are carrying a scepter, and wearing a crown.

data.short_motivation: I need to remove my crown so that I can be humble before God and my sins.
data.mid_motivation: I will be confessing to the priests about my past sins and ask to be forgiven.
data.long_motivation: I must confess my sins and perform several rituals before my marriage ceremony with the neighboring country's princess.
